definition: catty/(PRC) weight equal to 500 g/(Tw) weight equal to 600 g/(HK, Malaysia, Singapore) slightly over 604 g
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)

sentences.english: They give short weight in that store.
sentences.chinese: 那家商店售貨斤兩不足。

sentences.english: They know what they are about and don' really care what others think.
sentences.chinese: 他們知道自己的斤兩也不在乎別人說自己什麼。

sentences.english: What the teacher said should not be taken lightly.
The first round of games will tell the truth.
sentences.chinese: 第一輪小組賽過後就會知道彼此的斤兩。

definition: hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
lit. the river that divides Chu and Han/fig. a line that divides rival territories/the mid-line between sides on a Chinese chessboard
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to tolerate is to nurture an evildoer (idiom); spare the rod and spoil the child
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
